macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Trump Announces Major Cryptocurrency Policy at Crypto Forum 2026
items.summary: Donald Trump delivered a highly anticipated announcement at the Trump Crypto Forum 2026 in Florida on February 21, addressing blockchain, Web3, and decentralized finance policy. The speech is expected to influence global crypto policy and the 2026 U.S. presidential race.

items.title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs Record Fifth Consecutive Week of Outflows
items.summary: U.S. spot bitcoin ETFs experienced approximately $316 million in net outflows during the Presidents' Day trading week, marking five straight weeks of outflows for the first time.

items.title: Crypto Startups Raise $95 Million as Investment Terms Improve
items.summary: Venture capital firms including Pantera Capital, Consensys, and Animoca Brands invested $95 million in crypto startups this week, with particular focus on prediction markets and AI-powered projects. Notable raises include Kresus Labs ($13M) and PlutonAI ($2.7M).

items.title: Lighter's DeFi Perpetuals Dominance Drops to 8.1% After Incentive Exhaustion
items.summary: Lighter's market share in DeFi perpetuals collapsed from a peak of 60% in mid-December 2025 to 8.1%, as liquidity incentives dried up and competitors like Hyperliquid (23.4% share) absorbed trading volume.

items.title: Bitcoin Shows Signs of Distribution Slowdown After $22B in Losses
items.summary: Bitcoin's main holders (1-2 year holders) have significantly reduced selling after BTC dropped below $72K, with the network's hash rate declining 14% over 90 days. VanEck projects potential BTC recovery in Q2 2026.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Generative AI Outperforms Human Teams in Analyzing Medical Data
items.summary: Researchers at UC San Francisco found generative AI can process complex medical datasets and generate prediction models faster than human teams, sometimes matching or exceeding their results in tasks like preterm birth prediction.

items.title: New Attack Reveals Sensitive Data Leaks from AI Model Edits
items.summary: Researchers demonstrated a vulnerability in large language model editing methods where parameter updates act as 'fingerprints' allowing attackers to recover edited sensitive information using a two-stage reverse-engineering attack.

items.title: Samsung Expands Galaxy AI with Multi-Agent Ecosystem
items.summary: Samsung announced an expansion of Galaxy AI, adding new AI agents across its ecosystem to provide users more choice, flexibility, and seamless integration for everyday tasks.

items.title: XGBoost Model Predicts Cardiac Tamponade Risk in AF Ablation
items.summary: A machine learning model using XGBoost achieved high accuracy (AUC 0.908) in predicting cardiac tamponade during atrial fibrillation catheter ablation, potentially improving patient risk stratification.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Microsoft Appoints Asha Sharma as New CEO of Xbox Gaming, Replacing Phil Spencer
items.summary: Microsoft has named AI executive Asha Sharma as the new CEO of its gaming division, succeeding retiring Xbox boss Phil Spencer, with Sarah Bond also departing and Matt Booty becoming chief content officer. The appointment has sparked online backlash accusing the company of 'Indian nepotism' due to Sharma's lack of gaming background.

items.title: New Xbox Boss Commits to Continued Multi-Platform Support Including PlayStation
items.summary: The incoming Xbox leadership, under new CEO Asha Sharma, vows to maintain support for PlayStation ports, stating developers can 'build once and reach players everywhere without compromise.' This follows PS5 overtaking Nintendo Switch 2 as US bestseller in January 2026.

items.title: Ubisoft Confirms Two Far Cry Games and Multiple Assassin's Creed Titles in Development
items.summary: Ubisoft announced yesterday the development of two Far Cry games alongside multiple Assassin's Creed titles, including some single-player story-driven experiences. This comes amid ongoing Resident Evil 9 leaks from Capcom.

items.title: Call of Duty Black Ops 7 Tops Sales Charts as Bestselling Game of January 2026
items.summary: Black Ops 7 propelled Call of Duty back to the number one spot as the bestselling game in the US for January 2026, coinciding with PS5 becoming the top-selling hardware that month over Nintendo Switch 2.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
